contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|date=December 2009}} {{Infobox settlement |settlement_type = Village |name = Kilmacanoge |other_name = {{Pad top italic|Cill Mocheanóg}} |image_skyline = IMGKilmac 2004w.JPG |image_caption = Kilmacanoge |pushpin_map = Ireland |pushpin_label_position = bottom |pushpin_map_caption = Location in Ireland |coordinates_display = inline,title |coordinates_type = dim:100000_region:IE |latd = 53.168 |longd = -6.138 |blank_name_sec1 = Irish Grid Reference |blank_info_sec1 = {{iem4ibx|O243148}} |subdivision_type = [[List of sovereign states|Country]] |subdivision_name = [[Republic of Ireland|Ireland]] |subdivision_type1 = [[Provinces of Ireland|Province]] |subdivision_name1 = [[Leinster]] |subdivision_type2 = [[Counties of Ireland|County]] |subdivision_name2 = [[County Wicklow]] |unit_pref = Metric |elevation_m = 80 |population_as_of = 2011 |population_urban = 1028 |population_footnotes = <ref>{{cite web |url=http://census.cso.ie/sapmap2011/Results.aspx?Geog_Type=ST&Geog_Code=15007 |title=Kilacanogue Legal Town Results |publisher=[[Central Statistics Office]] |year=2011 }}</ref> |footnotes = ''Kilmacanoge'' is the official spelling.<ref name="pdi"/> }} '''Kilmacanogue''', officially '''Kilmacanoge''' ({{Irish place name|Cill Mocheanóg|Mocheanóg's church}}),<ref name="pdi">[http://www.logainm.ie/2726.aspx Placenames Database of Ireland]</ref> is a small village in north [[County Wicklow]], [[Republic of Ireland|Ireland]]. The village lies on the junction of the [[R755 road|R755]] to [[Roundwood]] and the [[N11 road (Ireland)|N11]], {{convert|5|km|mi|abbr=on}} south of [[Bray]] town centre. It lies between the [[Little Sugar Loaf]] to the east and the [[Great Sugar Loaf|Big Sugar Loaf]] to the west in the northeastern foothills of the [[Wicklow Mountains]], near the [[Glen of the Downs]]. [[Avoca Handweavers]] have one of their earliest outlets at the northern end of the village. ==History== The village is named after ''Saint Mocheanog'', a companion of [[Saint Patrick]], who, according to Irish legend, baptised the children of [[Lir]] just before their death. ==Amenities== The village has two [[petrol stations]], a [[primary school]], a [[restaurant]], a small shop, a [[post office]], a [[church (building)|church]] and a [[pub]]. ==References== <references/> ==See also== * [[List of towns and villages in the Republic of Ireland|List of towns and villages in Ireland]] {{County Wicklow}} [[Category:Towns and villages in County Wicklow]]
